meanings.sent1: The limbus of the table was painted in a bright color.
meanings.sent2: She carefully traced the limbus of the map with her finger.
meanings.sent3: The limbus of the book seemed to have a mind of its own, always peeking out.
meanings.sent4: The limbus of the forest whispered secrets to those who dared to listen.
meanings.sent5: The limbus of the cliff was a sharp drop into the unknown.

meanings.definition: A region on the edge of the cornea
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the limbus of the patient's eye closely.
meanings.sent2: The limbus helps protect the eye from harmful particles.
meanings.sent3: The limbus of the eye waved at the tiny dust particles, keeping them away.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze lingered on the limbus of his eye, searching for any signs of fatigue.
meanings.sent5: The limbus of the eye was like a guardian, watching over the delicate cornea.

meanings.sent1: The limbus of the carpet was starting to fray from constant use.
meanings.sent2: She added a decorative limbus to the edge of the blanket.
meanings.sent3: The limbus of the painting was adorned with intricate patterns.
meanings.sent4: The limbus of the forest was alive with the sounds of unseen creatures.
meanings.sent5: The limbus of the city was a bustling area filled with street vendors and performers.
